answerText: Laplace transform[10] The inverse Laplace transform of e to the negative s yields this function of t minus 1. This function is the derivative of the Heaviside step function and is used as an impulse in engineering analysis.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Lawrence U and Georgia Tech | 18 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The inverse of this operation is given by the Bromwich integral, and it is generalized by the Borel transform. For ten points each:  [10] Identify this transform which yields the Fourier transform when its parameter "s" is replaced with "i times omega."
